ingredients.ingredient_label: Freshly cracked black pepper, divided, plus more for topping

instructions.text: Set a large pot of heavily salted water to boil. Cook the macaroni about a minute shy of the package instructions until al dente. Drain well.

ingredients.text: • 12 ounces elbow macaroni

instructions.text: In a large skillet, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium heat. Sprinkle the flour over the butter and whisk for 1 minute until a paste forms and the mixture begins to bubble but does not brown.

ingredients.text:
• 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter cubed
• 1/4 cup all-purpose flour

instructions.text: Gradually whisk in the warmed milk and turn the heat to medium-low as soon as the mixture thickens. Whisk in 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, the nutmeg, and the ground mustard.

ingredients.text: • 2 cups whole milk, warmed • 1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided • 1/4 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper • 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg • Pinch ground mustard

instructions.text: Stir in the cheeses; when thoroughly melted, add the cooked macaroni and stir well to combine.

ingredients.text:
• 5 ounces grated Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese
• 5 ounces shredded Kerrygold Skellig Cheese
• 5 ounces shredded Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese

instructions.text: Transfer the macaroni mixture to a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
In a small bowl, combine the panko, thyme leaves, and remaining salt and pepper. Sprinkle evenly over the macaroni mixture.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
• 2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves

instructions.text: Bake at 375°F, uncovered, until the sauce is bubbly on the sides and the panko is browned and crispy on top, about 15 minutes.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Large sweet onions (like Vidalia) sliced (about 8 cups)
A few cracks freshly ground black pepper, plus more for seasoning and garnishing
Sprigs fresh thyme, plus more to garnish

instructions.text: In an oven-proof stock pot or Dutch oven, melt the Kerrygold Salted Butter over medium heat.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Salted Butter

instructions.text: Add the onions and pepper and cook, stirring until the onions are deeply golden (but not brown) and caramelized, about 25 minutes.

ingredients.text:
• 3 pounds (3 to 4) large sweet onions (like Vidalia) sliced (about 8 cups)
• A few cracks freshly ground black pepper, plus more for seasoning and garnishing

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Sprinkle the onions with the flour, stir for one minute, then add the stock, thyme and bay leaves, scraping up all the browned bits at the bottom of the pan.

ingredients.text:
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 2 quarts beef, chicken or vegetable stock
• 10 sprigs fresh thyme, plus more to garnish
• 3 bay leaves
• Kosher salt, to taste

instructions.text: Simmer for 30 minutes until the flavors have melded. Remove and discard the thyme sprigs and bay leaves.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Turn on the broiler.
Pour the soup into oven-proof bowls, add a baguette slice to each and press down to submerge.

ingredients.text: • 8 to 10 baguette slices (from 1 medium baguette), toasted

instructions.text: Sprinkle with the Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, place on a sheet pan and broil until bubbly and golden brown.

ingredients.text: • 2 cups (8 ounces) Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, grated

instructions.text: Garnish with fresh thyme leaves and freshly cracked pepper.

ingredients.ingredient_label: All-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cut into big pieces
Rhubarb, trimmed, peeled, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces (about 1 1/2 cups)
Demerara sugar or another coarse sugar, for sprinkling on top

instructions.text: In a food processor fitted with a steel blade, combine the flour, sugar and salt. In a small bowl, beat the eggs and 1 tablespoon of the cream.

ingredients.text:
For the dough:
• 2 2/3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
• 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
• 1 teaspoon fine salt
• 2 large eggs
• 2 tablespoons heavy cream or milk

instructions.text: Add the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter to the flour mixture; pulse until you have lumps of butter the size of a black bean. Add the egg mixture and blend until it just barely comes together.

ingredients.text: • 1 cup (16 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cut into big pieces

instructions.text: Put the dough on a lightly floured surface and form into a 1-inch thick rectangle. Wrap in plastic and chill for at least 30 minutes.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl, combine the strawberries, rhubarb, sugar, cornstarch, citrus juice, zest, and vanilla extract.

ingredients.text:
For the filling:
• 8 ounces strawberries, hulled and quartered (about 1 1/2 cups)
• 8 ounces rhubarb, trimmed, peeled, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces (about 1 1/2 cups)
• 1/2 cup granulated sugar
• 2 tablespoons cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
• 2 teaspoons fresh orange zest
• 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small bowl, whisk the egg and milk.

ingredients.text:
• 1 large egg
• 3 tablespoons milk

instructions.text: Unwrap the pie dough and divide it into two pieces. Rewrap one piece and return it to the refrigerator.
On a flour-dusted surface, roll the dough into a large square; Cut into 8 equal-sized squares and place on the baking sheet. Add a few spoonfuls of filling and fold them into a turnover.
Crimp the edges with a fork, brush with the egg wash, and sprinkle with the coarse sugar. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.

ingredients.text: • A few tablespoons demerara sugar (such as Sugar in the Raw) or another coarse sugar (can substitute regular granulated sugar)

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted, plus more for cooking

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, beat the flour, milk and water with a whisk until smooth. Beat in the eggs, then add the melted Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, sugar and (a) pinch of salt.

ingredients.text:
For the crepes:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour • 1 cups whole milk • 1/3 cup lukewarm water • 2 large eggs • 3 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted, plus more for cooking • 1 tablespoons granulated sugar • Pinch of kosher salt

instructions.text: Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Bring the batter to room temperature and beat it again.

In a large non-stick skillet, melt a teaspoon of Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium heat. Scoop up 1/4 cup of batter and pour into the hot pan; lift and tilt it so that the batter covers the entire bottom surface.
When the batter dries, use a spatula to flip the crepe and cook it until brown, buttery spots appear on the underside, about 30 seconds.
Transfer the crepe to a plate and cover with foil. Repeat.
Make the filling; melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter in a large skillet. Add the brown sugar and cinnamon and stir until combined; stir in the bananas and cook until caramelized.

ingredients.text:
For the filling:
• 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter
• 1/4 cup light or dark brown sugar
• 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
• 4 large bananas, sliced into 1/4-inch coins

instructions.text: To serve, arrange a crepe on a plate, place some bananas in one quadrant, and fold in half and half again. Repeat.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve.

ingredients.text: • 1/4 cup powdered sugar

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter,  at room temperature

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300°F. Lightly grease an 8-inch baking dish.

In a medium bowl, beat the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, sugar, and salt together, then beat in the flour until a stiff dough forms. You may need to add a spoonful or two of water if the dough doesn’t come together.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter,  at room temperature
• 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar
• 1/2 teaspoon salt
• 1 cup all purpose flour

instructions.text: Press the dough into the prepared pan, smoothing the surface with a spatula or your hands.
Use a fork to prick the dough all over.
Bake the shortbread until it's a light golden brown across the top surface and a deeper golden brown around the edges, about 35 minutes.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Remove the shortbread from the oven and turn it out of the pan and onto a clean work surface.
While it’s still warm, cut the shortbread into four equal squares, then slice each quadrant into three equal strips, making twelve cookies. Transfer the shortbread to a cooling rack.

ingredients.ingredient_label: White button or cremini mushrooms, sliced
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Cubed, peeled Russet potatoes, boiled to fork tender

instructions.text: Heat the oven to 400ºF.
In a large skillet, melt the Kerrygold Salted Butter over medium heat. Add the onions, carrots, celery and garlic; cook, stirring, for two minutes.

ingredients.text:
• 5 tablespoons Kerrygold Salted Butter 
• 2 medium onions, diced 
• 3 medium carrots, peeled and diced 
• 2 ribs celery, chopped 
• 2 tablespoons chopped garlic

instructions.text: Add the mushrooms and thyme and stir often until all the vegetables are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.

ingredients.text:
• 16 ounces white button or cremini mushrooms, sliced 
• 2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves, chopped

instructions.text: Add the flour and stir until thoroughly combined with the vegetables. Cook for 3 minutes, or until the flour is golden brown.

ingredients.text: • 1/3 cup all-purpose flour

instructions.text: Pour in the broth, stirring constantly, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the filling thickens, about 3-4 minutes.

ingredients.text: • 3 1/2 cups chicken or vegetable broth

instructions.text: Season the filling with salt and pepper, to taste. Add the peas, potatoes and parsley; stir to combine. Transfer the filling to a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.

ingredients.text:
• Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
• 1 cup frozen peas
• 3 cups cubed, peeled Russet potatoes, boiled to fork tender
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley leaves

instructions.text: Assemble the pastry sheet on top of the baking dish and cinch the top edges with your fingers. With a knife, cut three slits for air vents.

ingredients.text: • 1 sheet (10” x 15”) frozen puff pastry, thawed

instructions.text: Bake for 30-40 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Set a large pot of salted water to boil. Add the potatoes and cook until fork-tender, about 10 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a colander set over a bowl.

ingredients.text: • 3 russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1 inch cubes

instructions.text: To the same water, add the broccoli and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Place the colander into the sink and drain the broccoli over the top.

ingredients.text: • 1 medium head broccoli (2 1/2 to 3 pounds), florets and stems cut into bite-sized pieces

instructions.text: In a small saucepan, heat the milk over medium until small bubbles appear around the edges, then shut off the heat.

ingredients.text: • 2 cups whole milk

instructions.text: In a large skillet with high sides, melt 3 tablespoons of the Kerrygold Salted Butter over low heat. Whisk in the flour to form a paste and cook, constantly whisking, for one minute.

ingredients.text:
• 3 tablespoons Kerrygold Salted Butter, divided
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour

instructions.text: Gradually whisk in the warm milk. Add 1 cup of Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese and the nutmeg and whisk until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Turn off the heat.

ingredients.text: • 1 1/4 cups (about 2 1/2 ounces) grated Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, divided (If you prefer a cheesier, gooier version, you can substitute up to 1/2 with shredded Kerrygold Aged Cheddar)
• 1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg

instructions.text: Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper, then add the potato-broccoli mixture. Mix well to combine, then transfer to a 9 x 13-inch or 3 to 4 quart casserole dish.

ingredients.text: • Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

instructions.text: Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup of Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, bread crumbs, and thyme leaves and bake until bubbly along the edges and golden brown on top, about 15 minutes.

ingredients.text:
• 1/4 cup panko bread crumbs
• 1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves

ingredients.ingredient_label: All-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese, finely grated

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line two half sheet pans with parchment paper.
Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Toss Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese with dry ingredients until well combined.

ingredients.text:
• 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt
• 1 (7-ounce) block Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese, finely grated

instructions.text: Stir in the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and cream until the dough comes together. If it is too dry, add a tablespoon or two of cold water.

ingredients.text:
• 4 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, softened
• 2 tablespoons heavy cream

instructions.text: Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, then separate the dough into two halves and wrap it in plastic. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Re-flour the surface and roll each portion into a 1/8”-thick rectangle.
Transfer each to a prepared pan and cut into approximately 1-inch squares. Poke a hole in the center of each cracker.
Sprinkle a tiny pinch of salt on each cracker.

ingredients.text: • Flaky salt, for sprinkling

instructions.text: Bake for about 12-14 minutes, until golden brown.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, plus more to grease the pan
Plain whole-milk yogurt (can also use full-fat buttermilk)
Demerara sugar or other coarse sugar, optional (to sprinkle on top)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF.
Grease a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan and line it with parchment paper.
Peel one banana and lay it on a cutting board. Slice it in half lengthwise to create a cut side that lays flat.

ingredients.text: • 5 very ripe small bananas

instructions.text: In a small bowl, mash the four remaining bananas with the vanilla (you’ll have about 2 cups of mashed bananas).

ingredients.text: • 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract

instructions.text: In a larger bowl, cream together the brown sugar, Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, then add the yogurt, and eggs, making sure no dry clumps of brown sugar remain. Add the mashed banana and stir to combine. Set aside.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup lightly packed dark brown sugar • 10 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, plus more to grease the pan
• 1/3 plain whole-milk yogurt (can also use full-fat buttermilk) • 2 large eggs

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.

ingredients.text:
• 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1/4 teaspoon fine salt

instructions.text: Fold this into the banana mixture, and then pour it into your prepared pan. Smooth the top with a spatula and place the sliced banana, cut side facing up, into the batter. Sprinkle with the coarse sugar.

ingredients.text: • 2 tablespoons Demerara sugar or other coarse sugar, optional (to sprinkle on top)

instructions.text: Bake for about 1 hour until a cake tester comes out clean, and the top of the loaf is set. Let cool in the pan for at least 20 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Graham cracker crumbs (from about 11 full sheet crackers)
Packages cream cheese, softened for at least 1 hour to room temperature

instructions.text: Position a rack on the level just below the center of the oven and preheat to 350ºF.

In a small bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, 2 tbsp granulated sugar, and salt. Pour in the melted Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and stir until the crumbs are evenly moistened and feel like wet sand.

ingredients.text:
For the crust:
• 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs (from about 11 full sheet crackers)
• 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
• Pinch fine salt
• 5 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted

instructions.text: Press the mixture into the bottom of an 8-inch round springform pan, tamping down in a tight, even layer with the flat bottom of a glass.
Bake until the crust begins darkening, about 18-20 minutes. Set the pan on a wire rack to cool. Lower the oven temperature to 325ºF.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: With a mixer, beat the cream cheese on medium until fluffy. Slowly beat in the sugar, flour, and salt. Beat in the sour cream, lemon juice and zest. Add each egg, beating until just combined.

ingredients.text: For the filling: • 4 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened for at least 1 hour to room temperature • 1 cup granulated sugar • 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour • 1/2 teaspoon fine salt • 1/3 cup sour cream (can substitute heavy cream) • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • 1 tablespoon grated lemon zest  • 4 large eggs, at room temperature

instructions.text: Pour the mixture into the pan. Bake until the filling is puffy around the edges and the top is set, but the center still jiggles slightly when shaken gently about 50-60 minutes.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Turn off the heat and open the door slightly. Let the cake cool for 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and set it on a rack for 10 minutes. Run a thin knife around the edge to loosen the crust. Cool for 1 hour.
Refrigerate for at least 3 hours, ideally overnight, before removing the outer ring of the pan. Let the cake stand at room temperature for 20 minutes before serving.
Preheat the oven to 350ºF. Place cupcake liners in a standard 12-cup muffin pan.
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Whisk until combined.

ingredients.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
• 1/2 teaspoon fine salt

instructions.text: Place the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer and beat on medium until well combined, fluffy and pale yellow. Add the eggs, one at a time until fully combined. Add the vanilla.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, softened
• 1 cup granulated sugar
• 2 large eggs
• 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

instructions.text: Turn the mixer to low and add the dry ingredients and buttermilk alternately in 2 batches, turning off the mixer and scraping down the bowl between additions. Mix until just incorporated.

ingredients.text: • 1 cup buttermilk (or 1 cup whole milk with 1 tablespoon replaced with lemon juice or white vinegar)

instructions.text: Fill each liner 2/3 full.

Bake for 15 - 20 minutes until a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and put on a rack until cool enough to invert each cupcake. Finish cooling the cupcakes on the rack.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: All-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes and chilled, plus more for greasing the pan
Whole milk, plus more if needed

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF. Grease an 8-inch round cake pan.

Mix the flour, baking powder, and cinnamon in a large bowl. Mix in the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter using 2 butter knives or your hands until the dough forms a shaggy mass. Add the milk and mix until a ball forms.

ingredients.text:
For the dough:
• 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 6 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes and chilled, plus more for greasing the pan
• 3/4 cup whole milk

instructions.text: In a small bowl, mix the filling ingredients. Set aside.

ingredients.text:
For the filling:
• 1/4 cup Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted
• 1/2 cup chopped pecans or walnuts (optional)
• 3/4 cup light or dark brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• Pinch salt

instructions.text: Place the dough ball on a floured countertop and knead it a few times. Roll out a 10” x 12” rectangle with a rolling pin. Spread the filling mixture to within about 1/4” of the edges.
Tightly roll up the dough on the long side. Pinch the outer edge into the log to seal. Cut off the ends without filling and discard. Cut the log into 10 pieces and nestle them inside the cake pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the tops are brown and the filling is bubbling.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Mix the cream cheese, Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, and vanilla until fluffy in a medium bowl. Add the confectioners’ sugar in batches; scrape down the sides as you go. Add the milk and lemon zest and mix until combined.

ingredients.text:
For the icing:
• 3 tablespoons block-style cream cheese, softened
• 1 tablespoon Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, softened
• 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
• 1 1/4 cup confectioners’ sugar
• 2 tablespoons whole milk, plus more if needed
• 1 tablespoon freshly grated lemon zest

instructions.text: Allow the rolls to cool at least 5 minutes before drizzling the icing over the top while still in the pan. To serve, slice between the buns with a table knife and lift out with a spatula.
Place the flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs in 3 separate shallow bowls. Season with salt and pepper.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 large eggs, beaten
• 3 cups dried breadcrumbs

instructions.text: Slice the cutlets in half lengthwise. Place a cutlet between plastic wrap and use a rolling pin or meat mallet to pound thin. Repeat with remaining cutlets.

ingredients.text: • 3 thin boneless, skinless chicken breasts

instructions.text: Heat the oil and Kerrygold Salted Butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the butter is melted.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup neutral oil
• 3 tablespoons Kerrygold Salted Butter

instructions.text: Dredge a cutlet in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs, making sure to coat thoroughly.
Transfer to the pan and cook, flipping once, until golden brown and the chicken is cooked through about 3 minutes.
Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate and season both sides with salt and pepper. Repeat with remaining cutlets.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes

instructions.text: In a small skillet, toast the nuts until fragrant. Shut off the heat and set it aside.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 cup crushed walnuts, pecans or almonds

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan, heat the brown sugar, Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, and cream over medium until the butter is melted.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup light or dark brown sugar
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
• 1/2 cup heavy cream

instructions.text: Bring the sauce to a simmer, constantly stirring, until the sauce is smooth, about 2-3 minutes; shut off the heat and set aside.
Stir the caramel sauce in heat until smooth.
In a bowl, add two scoops of ice cream. Drizzle with the caramel sauce.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 gallon vanilla ice cream

instructions.text: Sprinkle with nuts and serve immediately.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cubed, plus more for greasing

instructions.text: Place an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350ºF.
Line an 8 x 8-inch baking pan with parchment paper so that it hangs over 2 sides of the pan. Lightly grease the pan and parchment with Kerrygold Unsalted Butter.
In a double boiler or a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and chocolate, stirring frequently. Remove the pan from the heat and whisk in the sugars.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cubed, plus more for greasing
• 6 ounces semisweet bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped
• 1/3 cup granulated sugar
• 1/3 cup packed dark brown sugar

instructions.text: In a small bowl, beat the eggs with the vanilla until light and fluffy. Vigorously whisk the egg mixture into the chocolate mixture for about a minute until smooth and glossy.

ingredients.text:
• 3 large eggs
• 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

instructions.text: Stir in the flour, salt, and baking powder.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
• 1/2 teaspoon salt
• 1/4 teaspoon baking powder

instructions.text: Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan. Sprinkle with the chocolate morsels.

ingredients.text: • 3/4 cup chocolate morsels

instructions.text: Bake for 25-30 min or until a cake tester inserted in the middle comes out with a few crumbs. Do not overbake! The edges of the brownies should look firm, and the center should be slightly moist.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Remove to a rack to cool completely before slicing. Cut into 5 strips. Cut each strip crosswise into 5 mini brownies.
Place the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter in the bowl of a stand mixer and beat at medium speed until smooth, creamy, and pale yellow, about 3 minutes.

ingredients.text: • 3/4 cup (6 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, softened

instructions.text: Stop the mixer, add about 1/3 of the powdered sugar, and then beat on low until incorporated. Repeat twice with the remaining powdered sugar, stopping the mixer when adding the sugar.

ingredients.text: • 2 1/4 cups powdered sugar

instructions.text: With the mixer on low, add the heavy cream, vanilla, lemon zest, and salt.

ingredients.text:
• 3 tablespoons heavy cream
• 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon freshly grated lemon zest
• Pinch of salt

instructions.text: Mix until everything is incorporated, then increase speed to medium-high and beat until frosting is smooth and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
Add food coloring if using and mix until evenly incorporated.

ingredients.text: • Food coloring, if desired

instructions.text: If not using right away or the frosting gets too soft to spread, chill the frosting in the refrigerator and re-whip before decorating.
Preheat the oven to 350ºF and line 2 large sheet pans with parchment paper.
In a small mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, baking soda, and baking powder. Set aside.

ingredients.text:
• 1 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
• 1/2 teaspoon fine salt
• 1/8 teaspoon baking soda
• 1/8 teaspoon baking powder

instructions.text: Place the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and sugars in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer or wooden spoon) and beat on medium until well combined.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, softened
• 3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar
• 1/4 cup granulated sugar

instructions.text: Add the egg and vanilla extract and beat until the mixture is smooth and glossy, about 30 seconds (1 minute if by hand.) Fold in the flour mixture until combined, then fold in the chocolate morsels.

ingredients.text:
• 1 large egg
• 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
• 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate morsels

instructions.text: Place the bowl of batter in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes to allow the dough to firm up.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Remove the batter from the refrigerator and roll roughly 1 tbsp scoops of dough between your palms into balls. Place the balls on prepared baking sheets, spacing them at least 1 inch apart.
Bake for about 10 minutes until the cookies feel soft and slightly under-done.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Cool on a wire rack.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Tart apples, such as granny smith (about 8 medium apples), peeled, cored and chopped into 3/4 inch pieces (about 10 cups)
Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, plus more for greasing the pan
Packed light or dark brown sugar

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325º F. Grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
Place the chopped apples in a large mixing bowl with 1 quart of water combined with the lemon juice.

ingredients.text:
• 2 1/2 pounds tart apples, such as granny smith (about 8 medium apples), peeled, cored and chopped into 3/4 inch pieces (about 10 cups)
• 1 quart water
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice

instructions.text: In a skillet over medium heat, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter. Cook until brown and nutty, 3 to 4 minutes. Set aside.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, plus more for greasing the pan

instructions.text: Drain the apples. In the same bowl, combine the apples, granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, lemon zest, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and nutmeg. Toss to combine.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup granulated sugar
• 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, divided
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, divided
• 1 pinch ground nutmeg

instructions.text: Pour into the prepared pan.
In the same mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar, oats, remaining 3/4 cup flour, cinnamon, and salt.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup packed light or dark brown sugar
• 1 cup quick-cooking rolled oats
• 1/4 teaspoon fine salt

instructions.text: Drizzle the brown butter over the mixture and stir to combine. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the apples.
Bake for 40 minutes, until the top is toasty and the filling is bubbling. Serve immediately, with vanilla ice cream, if you wish.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, at room temperature, plus more for greasing

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325ºF. Grease a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan and set it aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt.

ingredients.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1/4 cup natural cocoa powder (not Dutch process)
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1/2 teaspoon fine salt

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, beat the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and sugar until fluffy, about 7 min. Add the eggs 1 at a time, and keep beating, ensuring each is incorporated before adding the next. Add the vanilla and beat.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, at room temperature, plus more for greasing
• 1 cup granulated sugar
• 3 large eggs, at room temperature
• 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

instructions.text: Add the flour mixture, continuing to mix until no dry ingredients are visible. Do not over-beat.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a rubber spatula.

Put the pan on a baking sheet and put it in the oven. Bake for 50-60 min, tenting with foil after 40 min. To test for doneness, insert a cake tester or skewer into the center; it should come out clean.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Let the cake cool in the pan for 20-30 min and then run a knife gently around the edges and remove it from the pan. Turn the cake out onto a cooling rack and let cool completely.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Cubed, peeled Russet potatoes, boiled to fork tender
Ground beef (for a vegetarian version, substitute 4 cups cooked brown lentils)
Fresh minced herb leaves (such as rosemary, sage and/or thyme)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF.
In a medium bowl, mash the potatoes with the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and nutmeg. Gradually add the milk, stirring and mashing until fluffy. Season and set aside.

ingredients.text:
For the potato topping:
• 3 cups cubed, peeled Russet potatoes, boiled to fork tender
• 1/2 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted
• Pinch of ground nutmeg
• 1/2 cup whole milk
• Kosher salt, to taste

instructions.text: In a large skillet, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium heat. Add the onions, celery, carrots, and garlic and cook, occasionally stirring, until softened, about 8 minutes.

ingredients.text:
For the filling:
• 3 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter • 1 medium yellow onion, diced • 2 stalks celery, diced • 1 large carrot, diced • 4 teaspoons minced garlic

instructions.text: Add the beef, using a spoon to stir and break up any large pieces, cooking until browned and thoroughly combined with the vegetables.

ingredients.text: • 1 pound ground beef (for a vegetarian version, substitute 4 cups cooked brown lentils)

instructions.text: Stir in the flour. Add a splash of the stock and use the wooden spoon to scrape up any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pan.

ingredients.text: • 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour

instructions.text: Add the remaining stock, tomato paste, rosemary, thyme, Worcestershire sauce, and peas; stir to combine.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup beef or vegetable stock
• 1 tablespoon tomato paste
• 2 tablespoons fresh minced herb leaves (such as rosemary, sage and/or thyme)
• 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
• 1 cup frozen peas

instructions.text: Reduce the heat to low and cook until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

ingredients.text: • Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.text: Transfer the filling to a 9 x 13-inch baking dish, then top with the potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes until the sauce bubbles. Garnish with parsley and serve.

ingredients.text: • 1/4 cup chopped Italian flat leaf parsley

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into cubes
Chopped cilantro, plus more for serving"

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the garlic, ginger, spices, salt and pepper.

ingredients.text: • 3 cloves garlic, minced • 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger • 1 tablespoon ground cumin • 1 tablespoon garam masala • 2 teaspoons ground coriander • 2 teaspoons ground turmeric • 1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom • Pinch of crushed red pepper (optional) • Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, combine half the spice mixture with 3 tablespoons of yogurt and all of the chicken; marinate from 1 hour to overnight.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup plain whole milk yogurt, plus 3 tablespoons for marinating
• 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into cubes

instructions.text: Set the oven to broil. On a foil-lined sheet pan, broil the chicken, occasionally stirring, until browned all over but not cooked through. Set aside.

In a large skillet, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until golden, about five minutes. Add the remaining spice mixture and cook until aromatic, about three minutes.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter
• 1 large onion, sliced

instructions.text: Stir in the tomato paste, then add the tomatoes, cilantro and remaining yogurt all at once; stir quickly to form a creamy sauce.

ingredients.text:
• 1/4 cup tomato paste
• One 14-ounce can crushed tomatoes (about 2 cups)
• 1/2 cup chopped cilantro, plus more for serving

instructions.text: Add the reserved chicken and juices and cook at a low simmer until the sauce thickens, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream.

ingredients.text: • 2 tablespoons heavy cream

instructions.text: Serve with rice and sprinkle with remaining cilantro and almonds.

ingredients.text:
• Cooked basmati rice, for serving
• Slivered almonds, for serving

ingredients.ingredient_label: Extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Packed cup mixed chopped herb leaves
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan, bring the stock to a simmer over medium heat.

ingredients.text: • 2 quarts chicken or vegetable stock

instructions.text: In a Dutch oven, melt 1 tbs Kerrygold Salted Butter in oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring, until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and stir until aromatic, about 1 minute.

ingredients.text:
• 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
• 3 tablespoons Kerrygold Salted Butter
• 1 medium yellow onion, diced
• 2 teaspoons minced garlic

instructions.text: Add the rice and stir until coated and toasty. Using a metal or glass measuring cup, scoop up a cup of the stock and add it to the rice, stirring constantly until fully absorbed, about 2 minutes.

ingredients.text: • 2 cups short grain rice, such as Arborio, Vialone Nano, Carnaroli or sushi rice

instructions.text: Add another cupful of stock, stirring until fully absorbed for another 2 minutes.
Keep stirring and adding more stock, a cupful at a time, making sure the stock is fully absorbed between additions, about 15 minutes.
When the rice is al dente, stir in the Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese and the herbs and another cupful of stock and cook until the mixture is creamy.

ingredients.text:
• 1 cup grated Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, plus more for garnishing
• 1 packed cup mixed chopped herb leaves such as basil, dill, parsley, thyme, sage and fennel fronds, plus more for garnishing

instructions.text: Shut off the heat, stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of Kerrygold Salted Butter and season to taste with salt and pepper.

ingredients.text: • Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.text: Serve immediately, sprinkled with more Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.text: Season both sides of the salmon with salt and pepper to taste.

ingredients.text:
• 1 pound (1-inch-thick) salmon fillet, cut into 4 equal pieces
• Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.text: In a 12-inch skillet, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium-low heat.

ingredients.text: • 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter

instructions.text: While the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter is melting, grate the yellow part only of the lemon into the melting butter.

ingredients.text: • 1 whole lemon

instructions.text: Put the salmon skin-side down in the skillet and cook for 3 min, spooning butter over the top. Flip the fish and keep cooking and basting for about 3 minutes until the salmon pulls apart quickly when probed with a fork.
Place each piece, skin side down, on a plate.
Slice the grated lemon into quarters and squeeze about a tablespoon of lemon juice over each piece of salmon. Serve immediately.

name.text: Pan Fried Steak w/ Herb Butter Sauce

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, divided and softened
Chopped herbs (such as parsley, rosemary, thyme, tarragon)
Cloves roasted garlic, mashed into a paste
Boneless beef steak (about 1 pound) such as strip, rib-eye, flank, flat iron, or hanger, 1 to 1-1/2 inches thick

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl, mash all but 1 tablespoon of Kerrygold Unsalted Butter with herbs, shallots, and garlic. Season to taste.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, divided and softened
• 1 tablespoon chopped herbs (such as parsley, rosemary, thyme, tarragon)
• 1 tablespoon minced shallot
• 2-3 cloves roasted garlic, mashed into a paste

instructions.text: Pat the steaks dry and sprinkle on all sides with 2 teaspoons salt.

ingredients.text:
• 2 teaspoons salt, plus more to taste
• Freshly ground black pepper
• 1 1/2 - 2 pounds boneless beef steak (about 1 pound) such as strip, rib-eye, flank, flat iron, or hanger, 1 to 1-1/2 inches thick

instructions.text: Heat a heavy 10-inch or larger cast iron skillet on high heat. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of Kerrygold Unsalted Butter; when melted, add the steaks in a single layer.
Let the steak sit for 1 minute. Using tongs, flip and cook for 1 minute. Continue flipping the steak every 30 seconds. After two minutes, add a few pinches of pepper.
Transfer the steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 - 10 minutes. Cut slices on the diagonal against the grain.
Turn the heat to medium-low. Pour in the stock and use a wooden spoon to scrape any brown bits stuck to the bottom of the pan.

ingredients.text: • 1 cup beef or chicken stock

instructions.text: Add the compound butter and whisk until melted. Turn the heat to medium and stir until the sauce thickens slightly. Season to taste.
Drizzle the steak slices with the pan sauce and serve.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Butter one side of each bread slice with Kerrygold Salted Butter.

ingredients.text:
• 10 slices of any bread you like
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Salted Butter, softened

instructions.text: On a sheet pan, place five bread slices buttered-side down and top with Kerrygold Reserve Cheddar Cheese.

ingredients.text: • 12 ounces Kerrrygold Reserve Cheddar Cheese, grated

instructions.text: Arrange the remaining five slices of Kerrygold Reserve Cheddar Cheese on top, buttered-side up.
Bake for 10 minutes, until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is fully melted.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Transfer to a cutting board and cut in half. Serve immediately.

ingredients.ingredient_label: All-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, chopped into 1/2-inch pieces and refrigerated

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350° F.
Make the dough: In a food processor, pulse the flour and salt a few times, then add half the cold Kerrygold Unsalted Butter. Pulse 5-8 times until pea-sized pieces form.

ingredients.text:
For the dough:
• 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
• 1 teaspoon kosher salt
• 1 stick Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, chopped into 1/2-inch pieces and refrigerated

instructions.text: Drizzle the water over the top, then add the remaining Kerrygold Unsalted Butter. Pulse until the dough resembles wet sand. Form into a ball, wrap in plastic and chill for 10 minutes.

ingredients.text: • 3 tablespoons ice water

instructions.text: On a lightly floured surface, press the dough into a disc and roll it into a circle slightly larger than a 9-inch pie plate; crimp the edges with your fingers or a fork.
Line with parchment and fill with dried beans. Bake for 20 minutes, remove the paper and weights and bake for 10 minutes until just brown. Remove to cool.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Make the filling: In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, cream, thyme, salt and pepper.

ingredients.text:
For the filling:
• 3 large eggs
• 1 1/2 cups heavy cream
• 1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves
• 1/2 teaspoon salt
• Freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Scatter the Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese and bacon evenly over the pie crust, then pour the egg mixture over the top.

ingredients.text:
• 2 cups Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese
• 10 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled

instructions.text: Bake for 35 minutes, until the quiche sets.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: In a cast-iron skillet or other heavy-bottomed pot, melt the Kerrygold Salted Butter over medium heat.

ingredients.text: • 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Salted Butter

instructions.text: Add the nuts to the melted Kerrygold Salted Butter and stir to coat well.

ingredients.text: • 2 cups raw nuts of your choice

instructions.text: Cook the nuts in the melted Kerrygold Salted Butter, taking great care not to burn them, constantly stirring, for about 5 min.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the nuts to a paper towel.
Sprinkle with a few pinches of flaky salt.

ingredients.text: • Flaky salt, to taste

instructions.text: When cool enough to handle, serve, or cool completely, then store in a sealed container.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Maple syrup (preferably the darker-colored grade B)
Sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into 1-inch cubes or half moons
Kosher salt and a few cracks freshly grated black pepper
Pecan or walnut pieces (substitute crushed pepitas for nut allergies)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a large sheet pan with foil.
In a large ovenproof skillet, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium-high heat.

ingredients.text: • 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter

instructions.text: When the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter is fully melted, add the maple syrup, lime juice and smoked paprika and stir to combine.

ingredients.text:
• 3/4 cup maple syrup (preferably the darker-colored grade B)
• 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lime juice
• 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika

instructions.text: Add the sweet potatoes and toss until thoroughly coated; season. Cook until the sauce comes to a boil, stirring occasionally, then shut off the heat.

ingredients.text: • 2 pounds (about 3 medium) sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into 1-inch cubes or half moons

instructions.text: Cover the skillet with foil and transfer to the oven. Roast until the glaze is thick, and the potatoes can be easily pierced with a fork, about 30 minutes.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and a few cracks freshly grated black pepper

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: Carefully remove the skillet from the oven, remove the foil, and toss the glazed potatoes with the zest.

ingredients.text: • 1 teaspoons freshly grated lime zest

instructions.text: Sprinkle the pecan pieces on top and return to the oven

ingredients.text: • 1/2 cup pecan or walnut pieces (substitute crushed pepitas for nut allergies)

instructions.text: Bake until the nuts are toasted, 5-7 minutes. Serve immediately.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Large tart apple - peeled, cored and sliced into 1/4” wedges

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425ºF.
In a large bowl or blender, whisk the eggs, milk, flour, 1 tablespoon of sugar and salt. Let stand for at least 15 minutes at room temperature.

ingredients.text:
• 3 large eggs
• 1/2 cup whole milk
• 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
• 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon granulated sugar, divided
• 1/4 teaspoon fine salt

instructions.text: Mix the remaining 1/2 cup sugar with the cinnamon and nutmeg in a small bowl.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg

instructions.text: Melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter in a 9 or 10-inch oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the apples and the sugar mixture to the pan and cook, stirring, until the apples soften, about 8 min.

ingredients.text:
• 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter
• 1 large tart apple - peeled, cored and sliced into 1/4” wedges

instructions.text: Pour the batter over the apples and place it in the oven.
Bake until the pancake is golden and set in the centre, about 12-15 min. Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack for 5 min.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: To serve, cut the pancake into wedges.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Sliced baguette bread, about an inch wide, sliced on the diagonal
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Large romaine heart, chopped (about 5 cups or 10 ounces)
Freshly grated lemon zest, for topping (optional)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
On a sheet pan, bake the bread for about 5 minutes until golden, flipping halfway.

ingredients.text:
For the croutons:
• 10 to 12 slices baguette bread, about an inch wide, sliced on the diagonal

instructions.text: Rub the garlic on both sides of the croutons and drizzle with melted Kerrygold Salted Butter and salt.

ingredients.text:
• 3 to 4 garlic cloves
• 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) Kerrygold Salted Butter, melted
• Kosher salt, to taste

instructions.text: In a large bowl with a whisk, mash the anchovies, garlic and a pinch of salt in a few tablespoons of the olive oil to form a paste.

ingredients.text:
For the salad:
• 2 oil-packed anchovy fillets, roughly chopped (optional)
• 2 teaspoons minced garlic
• Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
• 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil

instructions.text: Whisk in the mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce.

ingredients.text:
• 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
• 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
• 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice
• 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce

instructions.text: Add the romaine and toss well to coat.

ingredients.text: • 1 large romaine heart, chopped (about 5 cups or 10 ounces)

instructions.text: Garnish with the croutons, Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, lots of freshly ground black pepper, and lemon zest, if using.

ingredients.text:
• 1/4 cup (about 1/2 ounce) grated Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, divided
• Freshly grated lemon zest, for topping (optional)

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, softened, plus more for greasing

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF. Grease a 9 x 9-inch baking dish and set aside.
In a medium mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, baking powder, 3/4 teaspoon of salt, and baking soda. Set aside.

ingredients.text:
• 3 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, divided
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon fine salt
• 1/2 teaspoon baking soda

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened Kerrygold Unsalted Butter and granulated sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time. Add the vanilla and beat well.

ingredients.text:
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, softened, plus more for greasing
• 1 cup granulated sugar
• 2 large eggs, at room temperature
• 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

instructions.text: Add the flour mixture and sour cream, alternating between the two until just combined.

ingredients.text: • 1 cup sour cream, at room temperature

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine 3/4 cup of brown sugar and 1 tablespoon of cinnamon.

ingredients.text:
• 1 1/4 cup packed dark brown sugar, divided
• 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

instructions.text: Add half of the batter to the pan and spread evenly with a spatula. Sprinkle the brown sugar mixture on top. Dollop the remaining cake batter on the brown sugar mixture, and spread it evenly.
Whisk the remaining brown sugar, the melted Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, cinnamon, and salt in a medium bowl. Add the remaining flour and mix well. Sprinkle the streusel evenly over the batter.

ingredients.text: • 6 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted

instructions.text: Bake for 35-40 minutes until a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Transfer to a wire cooling rack and let cool for at least 30 min before slicing and serving.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Large leeks, white and very light green parts only, cleaned and sliced (about 3 cups)
Medium cloves garlic, peeled and smashed
Kosher salt, plus more to taste
Ground black pepper, plus more to taste
Yukon Gold or Russet potatoes, peeled and roughly chopped into 1/2-inch pieces (2 to 3 medium potatoes)
Finely chopped fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dried thyme
Finely chopped Italian parsley, for serving

instructions.text: In a 3 quart or larger pot, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium-low heat.

ingredients.text: • 3 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter

instructions.text: Add the leeks, garlic, salt and pepper, and cook, stirring often, until the leeks are soft but not brown, for about 8 minutes.

ingredients.text:
• 2 large leeks, white and very light green parts only, cleaned and sliced (about 3 cups)
• 2 medium cloves garlic, peeled and smashed
• 1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
• 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, plus more to taste

instructions.text: Add the potatoes, stock, and thyme to the pot and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer, covered, for about 10 - 12 minutes, or until the potatoes drop off the tip of a paring knife when pierced.

ingredients.text:
• 1 pound Yukon Gold or Russet potatoes, peeled and roughly chopped into 1/2-inch pieces (2 to 3 medium potatoes)
• 3 cups chicken or vegetable stock
• 1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dried thyme

instructions.text: Using an immersion blender or a regular blender (start on low and do not fill more than halfway; you will have to work in batches), puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and gently return to a simmer over low heat. Taste for seasoning and add more salt and/or pepper if needed.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 cup heavy cream

instructions.text: To serve, ladle into soup bowls and sprinkle a generous pinch of parsley on top.

ingredients.text: • 2 tablespoons finely chopped Italian parsley, for serving

ingredients.ingredient_label: Chopped fresh herbs, such as parsley and/or basil
A few cracks freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl, beat the eggs with a fork until well combined and frothy.

ingredients.text: • 2 large eggs

instructions.text: Beat in the herbs, salt, and pepper.

ingredients.text:
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs, such as parsley and/or basil
• Pinch of salt
• A few cracks freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: In a medium nonstick or well-seasoned cast iron skillet, melt the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter over medium high heat.

ingredients.text: • 1 tablespoon Kerrygold Unsalted Butter

instructions.text: Pour the egg mixture into the skillet.
Once set, add additional herbs and using a rubber spatula, flip the omelet.
Sprinkle with Kerrygold Reserve Cheddar Cheese and cover until cheese is melted, about 30 seconds.

ingredients.text: • 1/4 cup shredded Kerrygold Reserve Cheddar Cheese

instructions.text: Using the spatula, fold the omelet in half. Transfer to a plate to serve.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Finely chopped flat-leaf Italian parsley leaves
Finely minced garlic (from about 1 medium clove)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425° F.
In a small bowl, combine the Kerrygold Aged Cheddar, Mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses with butter, parsley, and garlic.

ingredients.text:
• 6 ounces shredded Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese
• 4 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese
• 2 ounces Parmesan cheese
• 4 tablespoons Kerrygold Salted Butter, softened
• 3 tablespoons finely chopped flat-leaf Italian parsley leaves
• 1 teaspoon finely minced garlic (from about 1 medium clove)

instructions.text: Place the bread on a foil-lined sheet pan, cut sides up, and spread the cheese mixture to the edges of both pieces.

ingredients.text: • 1 loaf baguette (about 12-inches long) halved lengthwise

instructions.text: Sprinkle evenly with the salt.

ingredients.text: • Pinch of kosher salt

instructions.text: Bake until the cheese is melted and bubbling, about 8 to 10 minutes.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

instructions.text: To serve, allow to cool slightly and then slice into 1 to 2-inch wide pieces.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, frozen and cut into 1cm cubes
Heavy cream, buttermilk, sour cream or whole milk yogurt

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400ºF. Line two 9 x 13-inch baking sheets with parchment paper and set aside.

Mix the flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper in a large mixing bowl. Blend the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter into the flour using a pastry cutter, two butter knives, or your hands (work quickly). Don’t overwork the dough.

ingredients.text:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon kosher salt
• 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, frozen and cut into 1cm cubes

instructions.text: Add 1 cup shredded Kerrygold Aged Cheddar and toss until coated in flour.

ingredients.text: • 1 1/4 cups shredded Kerrygold Aged Cheddar, divided

instructions.text: Whisk the 3/4 cup cream (or alternatives) and 1 egg together in a medium bowl. Pour the wet ingredient mixture into the dry ingredients and mix until it barely comes together.

ingredients.text:
• 3/4 cup heavy cream, buttermilk, sour cream or whole milk yogurt
• 2 large eggs

instructions.text: Dump the dough onto a clean counter and form it into a flat 8-inch disc about 1-inch thick. Slice into 8 equal wedges. Place four scones on each of the sheets, spaced evenly apart. Chill for 10 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk the remaining egg and the 2 tablespoons cream.

ingredients.text: • 2 tablespoons whole milk or heavy cream

instructions.text: Brush the scones with the egg wash (you won’t use it all), and sprinkle each with a pinch of the remaining shredded Kerrygold Aged Cheddar and a pinch of flaky salt.

ingredients.text: • Flaky salt, for topping

instructions.text: Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set your timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to boil. Cook the pasta 1 minute shy of the package instructions.

ingredients.text: • 1 pound fettuccine

instructions.text: Using a glass or metal measuring cup, scoop out two cups of the pasta cooking water; reserve. Drain the pasta.
In a large skillet, melt the Kerrygold Salted Butter over medium-low heat.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Salted Butter

instructions.text: Stir in the cream and half the cheese.

ingredients.text:
• 3/4 cup heavy cream
• 2 cups freshly grated Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese, plus ¼ cup more for serving

instructions.text: Add the pasta and toss, gradually adding the remaining Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese and some of the pasta cooking water to form a velvety sauce. Season to taste.

ingredients.text: • Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Serve immediately, with more Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese sprinkled on top.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, frozen and cut into 1cm cubes
Heavy cream, buttermilk, sour cream or whole milk yogurt
Demerara sugar or another coarse sugar (can substitute regular granulated sugar)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400ºF. Line two 9 x 13-inch baking sheets with parchment paper and set aside.

Mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Blend the Kerrygold Unsalted Butter into the flour using a pastry cutter, two butter knives, or your hands. Don’t overwork the dough.

ingredients.text:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1/2 cup granulated sugar
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon kosher salt
• 1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, frozen and cut into 1cm cubes

instructions.text: Add the blueberries and lemon zest and toss until coated in flour.

ingredients.text:
• 1 1/2 cups blueberries
• 1 tablespoon lemon zest

instructions.text: Whisk the 3/4 cup cream (or alternatives) and 1 egg together in a medium bowl. Pour the wet ingredient mixture into the dry ingredients and mix until it barely comes together.

ingredients.text:
• 3/4 cup heavy cream, buttermilk, sour cream or whole milk yogurt
• 2 large eggs

instructions.text: Dump the dough onto a clean counter and form it into a flat 8” disc about 1” thick. Slice into eight equal wedges. Place four scones on each of the sheets, spaced evenly apart. Chill for 10 minutes.
Whisk the remaining egg and the 2 tablespoons of cream in a small bowl.

ingredients.text: • 2 tablespoons whole milk or heavy cream

instructions.text: Brush the scones with the egg wash, and sprinkle each with a pinch of sugar.

ingredients.text: • 1 tablespoon demerara sugar or another coarse sugar (can substitute regular granulated sugar)

instructions.text: Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Serve with jam and/or Kerrygold Salted Butter or clotted cream.

additional_instruction.text: Don't forget to set a timer.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Kerrygold Salted Butter, melted and divided
A few cracks freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF
Heat a medium skillet over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of the melted Kerrygold Salted Butter.

ingredients.text: • 6 tablespoons Kerrygold Salted Butter, melted and divided

instructions.text: Add the onions and sauté until softened and barely brown, about 3 minutes.

ingredients.text: • 1/2 red onion, diced (about 2/3 cup)

instructions.text: Season with salt and pepper and set aside.

ingredients.text:
• 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
• A few cracks freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Place the tortillas on a flat work surface. Evenly distribute the Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese on one half of each tortilla and top with equal amounts of the onions. Fold the empty half over the cheese side.

ingredients.text:
• 10 flour tortillas (10” size)
• 3 cups (12 ounces) shredded Kerrygold Aged Cheddar

instructions.text: Lightly brush the tops with half the melted Kerrygold Salted Butter. Put the buttered sides down on a large sheet pan. Lightly brush the tops with the remaining melted butter.
Cover with foil and bake for about 10 minutes, until the Kerrygold Aged Cheddar Cheese is melted. Uncover and return to the oven to crisp for another 2-3 minutes.

ingredients.ingredient_label: Whole milk (2 1/4 cup for thinner pancakes)
Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted and cooled plus more for skillet and serving

instructions.text: Mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt thoroughly, either by hand with a wire balloon whisk or in the bowl of a food processor.

ingredients.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon fine salt

instructions.text: Beat the eggs and milk in a small mixing bowl, then add the melted Kerrygold Unsalted Butter.

ingredients.text:
• 2 large eggs
• 2 cups whole milk (2 1/4 cup for thinner pancakes)

instructions.text: Pour the egg mixture into the pancake mix and stir just enough to combine, do not over mix.
Heat a large skillet over medium-low heat. Place a teaspoon or so of butter in the skillet. When melted, scoop about 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot skillet.

ingredients.text: • 2 tablespoons Kerrygold Unsalted Butter, melted and cooled plus more for skillet and serving

instructions.text: Once you see bubbles appear on the surface, for about 2 to 3 minutes, flip the pancakes and cook the second side for about 1 minute, or until the bottom is lightly browned.
Serve immediately with Kerrygold Salted Butter and your favorite toppings.
